title: Contacts
text: You can email us via ask-jgi@bristol.ac.uk. Include in your email that you’re interested in joining REG.

title: How to get involved with REG
text:
To join:

Sign up to the UK RSE Slack instance.
Once you have signed up, email us for an invite to the #bristol-reg channel.

We’d like to encourage use of the Slack for peer-to-peer support (and cat photos!)
The UK RSE slack also brings together the UK-wide RSE and friends community. If you’re new, then there are lots of helpful channels on this Slack instance and it’s a very active community.

title: How to get involved with REG
text:
To join:

Sign up to the UK RSE Slack instance.
Once you have signed up, email us for an invite to the #bristol-reg channel.

We’d like to encourage use of the Slack for peer-to-peer support (and cat photos!)
The UK RSE slack also brings together the UK-wide RSE and friends community. If you’re new, then there are lots of helpful channels on this Slack instance and it’s a very active community.

title: How to get involved with REG
text:
Other ways to get involved

Mailing list grp-ResearchEngineering which also has a group calendar for our meetings (and somewhere to store all the documents linked to below). We’ll add you to this at the same time as the Slack channel.
Group meetings (optional) hybrid in Royal Fort House on the last Tuesday of every month, usually 3-4pm.
Research computing training for data science and RSE. Self-led courses on GitHub plus we run in-person and online courses during the year. Volunteer helpers welcome!
Reading group - currently reading Statistical Rethinking by Richard McElreath, hybrid in Royal Fort House and on MS Teams, roughly every two weeks.
Today I Learned (TIL) GitHub repo – for making interesting things we talk about on Slack more permanent, with minimal fuss. See the ‘contributing TILs’ for instructions.
Data Science Handbook GitHub website – in development and contributions welcome!

title: How to get involved with REG
text:
Also of interest

Data Ethics Club online journal club about doing data science ethically, every two weeks.
Alan Turing Institute liaison academics linking the University of Bristol to the wider Turing network and interest groups, for example.

title: Research Engineering Group at the University of Bristol
text:
Join our group


Join our Slack channel or get involved with our other activities.


















Training courses


We provide free training workshops to all University of Bristol staff and students.













Contact us


Find out more about what we do.












No matching items


We have over 30 members, including from the Jean Golding Institute, Advanced Computing Research Centre, Research IT, Bristol Centre for Supercomputing, LEAP Digital Health Hub, and embedded researchers across the University.
